description: Change of use of the commercial premises to flexible use falling within Use Classes E(d), E(e) and E(g) and extend the operation hour on Sundays, Bank and Public Holidays.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision. 
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [WLS/LD040/FA/G/001, Evacuation Map, Fire Alarm Layout and Fire Safety Statement. Received: 17/4/2024
Unnumbered Location Plan, PD101-A, PD102-A, PD103-A, PD201-A, PD202-A, PD203-A, Cover Letter, Letter from London Pilates4U. Received: 7/6/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - Noise Insulation
Prior to operational commencement of the gym use, the ceiling insulation and rubber mats must be installed as specified in the approved plans and documents and confirmed with photographic evidence provided to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. At no time shall the decibel levels within the gym exceed those described in the Sound Insulation Assessment, which are predicted to not exceed 79dB LAeq for general noise and 86dB(A) for maximum noise (weight impacts). 
Reason: To protect the amenities of adjoining occupiers.
Condition : 4 - Noise Impact Confirmation
Within 3 months following the operational commencement of the gym use, an acoustic report must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, that demonstrates noise levels from gym activities within the flat directly above the gym do not exceed those described in the Sound Insulation Assessment, which are predicted to not exceed 17 dB LAeq for general noise and 23 dB(A) for maximum noise (weight impacts). Acoustic measurements must be taken at a time of day when the gym is the busiest.
Reason: To ensure noise mitigation measures successfully protect the amenities of adjoining occupiers.
Condition : 5 - Management Plan
Prior to operational commencement of the gym use, a management plan detailing how the occupancy numbers will be controlled and how gym equipment that produces loud noises will be limited bust be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
Reason: To protect the amenities of adjoining occupiers and in the interest of traffic safety and parking.
